Sentencas: Existing electrochemical experiments and models of fuel oxidation postulate about the importance of different oxidation pathways and relative fuel conversion efficiencies, but specific information is often lacking.
Titulo: In situ studies of fuel oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Experiments described below present the first direct, in situ measurements of relevant chemical species formed on solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) cermet anodes operating with both butane and CO fuel feeds.
Titulo: In situ studies of fuel oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Raman spectroscopy is used to acquire vibrational spectra from SOFC anodes at 715 degrees C during operation.
Titulo: In situ studies of fuel oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Both C4H10 and CO form graphitic intermediates.
Titulo: In situ studies of fuel oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In the limit of a large oxide flux, excess butane forms ordered graphite but only transiently.
Titulo: In situ studies of fuel oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: At higher cell potentials (e.g., less current being drawn) ordered and disordered graphite form on the Ni cermet anode following exposure to butane, and under open circuit voltage (OCV) conditions the graphite persists indefinitely.
Titulo: In situ studies of fuel oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The chemistry of CO oxidation is such that ordered graphite and a Ni-COO intermediate form only at intermediate cell potentials.
Titulo: In situ studies of fuel oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Concurrent voltammetry studies show that the formation of graphite with butane at OCV leads first to decreased cell performance after exposure to 25 cm(3) butane, then recovered performance after 75 cm(3).
Titulo: In situ studies of fuel oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: CO voltammetry data show that at lower potentials the oxide flux through the YSZ electrolyte is sufficient to oxidize the Ni in the anode especially near the interface with the electrolyte.
Titulo: In situ studies of fuel oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells
